gold_answers: They can be frozen. Transfer to a large plate or a rimmed baking sheet and freeze until solid, about 1 hour. Transfer to a zipper-lock freezer bag and store in the freezer for up to 2 months. Allow to thaw on a plate covered with plastic wrap in the refrigerator overnight before cooking.
model_answers: Transfer to a large plate or a rimmed baking sheet and freeze until solid, about 1 hour.

gold_answers: Add sage leaves, season lightly with salt, and cook, turning the leaves occasionally, until crisp, about 2 minutes.
model_answers: Add sage leaves, season lightly with salt, and cook, turning the leaves occasionally, until crisp, about 2 minutes.

gold_answers: Using tongs, transfer the leaves to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
model_answers: Using tongs, transfer the leaves to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.

gold_answers: cook, stirring very gently, for 3 minutes.
model_answers: Using a slotted spoon, transfer the gnudi to the skillet with the butter, making sure that plenty of pasta water gets into the pan with the gnudi.

gold_answers: making sure that plenty of pasta water gets into the pan with the gnudi.
Shaking the pan and gently stirring the gnudi helps the butter and pasta water emulsify into a creamy sauce.
model_answers: until the butter and pasta water emulsify into a creamy sauce, about 1 minute.

gold_answers: The sauce is ready when the butter and pasta water emulsify into a creamy sauce, about 1 minute.
Transfer gnudi and butter sauce to a warm serving dish or to individual plates.
model_answers: Transfer gnudi and butter sauce to a warm serving dish or to individual plates.

gold_answers: Top with fried sage leaves and drizzle with browned butter. Sprinkle with Parmesan and black pepper and serve immediately.
model_answers: Top with fried sage leaves and drizzle with browned butter.

gold_answers: Top with fried sage leaves and drizzle with browned butter. Sprinkle with Parmesan and black pepper and serve immediately.
model_answers: Top with fried sage leaves and drizzle with browned butter. Sprinkle with Parmesan and black pepper and serve immediately.

gold_answers: Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice.
model_answers: Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups.

gold_answers: toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt. Toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt.

In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.
model_answers: In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet.

gold_answers: Large chunks are very tender, about 45 minutes, and small diced squash is browned in spots, about 30 minutes.
model_answers: small diced squash is browned in spots

gold_answers: Discard sage sprigs from large squash chunks.
model_answers: Discard sage sprigs from large squash chunks.

gold_answers: If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook.
model_answers: If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook.

gold_answers: flour and all of the water
Mix at low speed or by hand until salt and yeast are fully incorporated and dough is smooth.
model_answers: mix at low speed or by hand until salt and yeast are fully incorporated and dough is smooth.

gold_answers: Until salt and yeast are fully incorporated and dough is smooth.
model_answers: mix at low speed until they are fully incorporated and form a uniform dough.

gold_answers: the dough feels elastic and bounces partway back when indented with your thumb
model_answers: dough feels elastic and bounces partway back when indented with your thumb

gold_answers: cover with plastic wrap. Let dough stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.
model_answers: Working with wet hands and/or a plastic bench scraper, loosen the dough, then gently lift and pull the dough down towards you, folding it in half.

gold_answers: Working with oiled hands, gently transfer dough.
model_answers: gently transfer dough, being careful not to tear its surface, to a lightly oiled mixing bowl and cover with plastic wrap.

gold_answers: Using a bench knife, divide dough in half and shape each portion into a ball.
model_answers: Using a bench knife, divide dough in half and shape each portion into a ball.

gold_answers: Dust the tops of the dough balls with flour, cover with a towel, and let rest for 15 minutes.
model_answers: Dust the tops of the dough balls with flour, cover with a towel, and let rest for 15 minutes.

gold_answers: Flip the dough ball over so that the seams you just created are on the bottom and a smooth surface is on top. Let dough rest on the work surface, seam-side down, for 5 minutes.
model_answers: Now flip the dough ball over so that the seams you just created are on the bottom and a smooth surface is on top.

gold_answers: Transfer each dough ball, seam-side up, to a bowl or basket lined with a lightly floured linen cloth or plain, not-fuzzy kitchen towel.
model_answers: Transfer each dough ball, seam-side up, to a bowl or basket lined with a lightly floured linen cloth or plain, not-fuzzy kitchen towel. Refrigerate dough balls or store in a cool place until dough has nearly doubled in size, about 1 hour to 1 hour 30 minutes.

gold_answers: transfer each dough ball, seam-side up, to a bowl or basket lined with a lightly floured linen cloth or plain, not-fuzzy kitchen towel
model_answers: Refrigerate dough balls or store in a cool place until dough has nearly doubled in size, about 1 hour to 1 hour 30 minutes.

gold_answers: With a razor or paring knife, score the full surface of the dough with 2 parallel lines roughly 3 inches apart. With a spray bottle filled with water, lightly spritz the surface of the dough.
model_answers: With a spray bottle filled with water, lightly spritz the surface of the dough.

gold_answers: Return Dutch oven to oven, and reheat at 500°F for 10 minutes.
model_answers: Return Dutch oven to oven, and reheat at 500°F for 10 minutes.

gold_answers: return dutch oven to oven, and reheat at 500°f for 10 minutes. then repeat with the remaining ball of dough.
model_answers: Return Dutch oven to oven, and reheat at 500°F for 10 minutes.

gold_answers: Place lasagna noodles in a 9- by 13-inch baking dish and cover with warm water. Let soak 15 minutes
model_answers: Place lasagna noodles in a 9- by 13-inch baking dish and cover with warm water.

gold_answers: Pulse until roughly chopped, 6 to 8 short pulses.
model_answers: pulse until roughly chopped, 6 to 8 short pulses

gold_answers: Fit food processor with grater attachment and grate all of the Brussels sprouts.
model_answers: Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.

gold_answers: Heat butter in a large non-stick or cast iron skillet over high heat until foaming subsides. Add mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until all excess moisture evaporates and mushrooms begin to sizzle and brown, about 12 minutes.
model_answers: Heat butter in a large non-stick or cast iron skillet over high heat until foaming subsides.

gold_answers: When mushrooms are browned, add shallots, garlic, and thyme.
model_answers: When mushrooms are browned, add shallots, garlic, and thyme.
season to taste with salt and pepper

gold_answers: Cook, tossing occasionally, until well-charred on most sides, about 10 minutes.
model_answers: cook, tossing occasionally, until well-charred on most sides, about 10 minutes

gold_answers: Add remaining cup heavy cream and cook until reduced to a loose sauce-like consistency. Season to taste with salt and pepper and transfer to a large bowl.
model_answers: Add remaining cup heavy cream and cook until reduced to a loose sauce-like consistency.

gold_answers: To assemble lasagna, lay 1/6th of cheese sauce on bottom of lasagna pan. Add three noodles. Top with 1/4 of Brussels sprouts mixture, 1/4 of mushroom mixture, another 1/6th of cheese sauce, and a sprinkle of grated mozzarella.
model_answers: To assemble lasagna, lay 1/6th of cheese sauce on bottom of lasagna pan.

gold_answers: Repeat noodle, sprouts, and mushroom layer three more times.
model_answers: Transfer to oven and bake until heated through and top is browned and bubbly, about 30 minutes.

gold_answers: Sprinkle with Parmesan and parsley, let rest 10 minutes, and serve.
model_answers: Remove from oven sprinkle with Parmesan and parsley, let rest 10 minutes, and serve.

gold_answers: Remove from oven sprinkle with Parmesan and parsley, let rest 10 minutes, and serve.
model_answers: Remove from oven sprinkle with Parmesan and parsley, let rest 10 minutes, and serve.
